titleInfo.title: Letter No. 20 of 1833 from David Anderson Blane, Resident in the Persian Gulf, at Bushire, to Charles Norris, Chief Secretary to the Government, Political Department, Bombay

mods.abstract: The letter is forwarding a translation of a letter received by the Resident from the Government Agent at Sharga [Sharjah], concerning the progress of the Wahabees [Wahhabi] in Arabia, and the murder of Shaikh Tahnoon [Ṭaḥnūn bin Shakhbūṭ Āl Nahyān], Chief of the Beniyas [Bani Yas]; a copy of this enclosure is not included in this volume.It also forwards a copy of the Resident's reply to the Government Agent, dated 3 June 1833, which outlines how the agent should address the Wahabees, and also defends the British use of naval power to secure the restitution of plundered property.
